thread.title: LeBron James sends Cavs-Wizards to overtime with crazy buzzer-beater
thread.title_full: LeBron James sends Cavs-Wizards to overtime with crazy buzzer-beater

author: Jordan Greer (jgreer@sportingnews.com)
title: LeBron James sends Cavs-Wizards to overtime with crazy buzzer-beater
text:
February 6, 2017 10:01pm EST February 6, 2017 9:59pm EST LeBron James missed an open layup ... then totally redeemed himself! Cavs forward LeBron James (Getty Images) 
Updated at 10:01 p.m. ET 
Updated at 10:01 p.m. ET 
LeBron James went from the lowest of lows to the highest of highs in less than 12Â seconds of game time Monday night. 
With 11.1 seconds left in regulation and the Wizards leading the Cavs 118-117, James dribbled up the court, "Eurostepped" around John Wall (he traveled) and missed a wide-open layup.Â 
The Wizards corralled the rebound, and James walked back down the floor in disbelief wondering how he had missed his easiest shot of the game.Â LeBron James layup FOR THE WIN!!!! pic.twitter.com/zSMFgajCju â Rob Perez (@World_Wide_Wob) February 7, 2017 
After Wall drained two free throws to put Washington ahead by three, Kevin Love took the ball and heaved a perfect pass down the sideline to James. Catch, one dribble, fade, bank, net. The. King. đ pic.twitter.com/FOFGDIqc9Z â Bleacher Report (@BleacherReport) February 7, 2017 
As Harry Dunne would say, "LeBron, you totally redeemed yourself!" The bank shot sent the game to overtime, and several Twitter users had to suddenly send "no clutch gene" tweets back into draft mode. Watch This
